page.title: 01Warthill and Roseness Holm
page.content: This area is the eastern part of the parish of Holm in the East Mainland of Orkney It is fairly sparsey populated. Most of the area being covered by farms and small holdings given over to sheep and cattle. Between Warthill farm and Royy Farm the land is intensively farmed. The remaindder to the east is moorland and rough grazing. There are peat cuttings on roseness but these have long since been abandoned. Along the coastline,though only 50 metres at their highest point, are very spectacular cliffs with many gullies patforms and geos. On Roseness Point is a Cairn,these are very common archelogical sites in Orkney,this was the remains of a broch,though its origins are unknown.
